catList: This course introduces basic data communication concepts and covers such topics as data architecture and protocols, data transmission, data transport networks, internet services, convergence of voice and data networks, and network  management. Security aspect of communication networks is covered in the second part of this course where basic security issues and concepts like security policies, encryption, digital signatures, types of threats and security breaches, and different ways to secure networks (firewalls, virtual private networks) are discussed.

This course gives participants managerial implications in communication technologies along with basic data communication and web technologies concepts and techniques involved. Topics covered include data transmission architecture and protocols, internet services, network management, infrastructure for web technologies, enterprise network architecture decisions, advantages and weaknesses of web services, vendor and software selection, software agents for E-commerce. Basic security aspect of communication networks is also covered.
